title: Acknowledgment - NYPD
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This is in response to your request received by this office on {{ moment(date).format('dddd, MMMM D, YYYY') }} in which you requested access to certain records under the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL).

        Your request has been assigned to {{ user.title }} {{ user.last_name }} ({{ user.phone_number }}) of this office. Before a determination can be rendered, further review is necessary to assess the potential applicability of exemptions set forth in FOIL, and whether the records can be located. I estimate that this review will be completed, and a determination issued within {{ days }} business days of this letter.

        This is not a denial of the records you requested. Should your request be denied in whole or in part, you will then be advised in writing of the reason for any denial, and the name and address of the Records Access Appeals Officer.

        This is not a denial of the records you requested. Should your request be denied in whole or in part, you will then be advised in writing of the reason for any denial, and the name and address of the Records Access Appeals Officer.

title: CIS Letter CD-DVD
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This letter is in further response to your letter dated in which you requested access to NYPD records of an accident investigation pursuant to the N.Y. Public Officers Law §84 et seq., also known as the Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL").

        Because you and/or your client have demonstrated that you have an interest in the subject accident, §66-a of the Public Officers Law, rather than FOIL, governs the extent of disclosure that is available to you, and affords you greater access than could be obtained under FOIL.

        Accordingly, the records that you have been saved to the enclosed CD/DVD-ROM.

title: CIS Letter Redacted
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        This letter is in further response to your letter dated in which you requested access to NYPD records of an accident investigation pursuant to the N.Y. Public Officers Law §84 et seq., also known as the Freedom of Information Law ("FOIL").

        Because you and/or your client have demonstrated that you have an interest in the subject accident, §66-a of the Public Officers Law, rather than FOIL, governs the extent of disclosure that is available to you, and affords you greater access than could be obtained under FOIL.

        Accordingly, the records that you requested are enclosed. Please note that if the case folder contained records that did not directly pertain to the accident, such records are not included in the enclosed document(s).

title: E-Mail
content:
Dear Sir or Madam:

        An Email that you sent to the New York City Police Department has been forwarded to this unit for a response. Your E-Mail requests access to records that may be in the possession of the New York City Police Department. To facilitate a proper response to your request, a Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request form is enclosed. Please fill out the form with as much information as you have regarding the records you are requesting. Upon our receipt of the completed form a search for such records must be conducted. If records responsive to your request are located, such records must be reviewed to assess the applicability of any particular exemptions from disclosure set forth in FOIL. I estimate that this process will be completed within 30 days of our receipt of the attached form.

        You must provide this information to the unit within thirty days of the date of this letter, addressed to the attention of {{ user.title }} {{ user.last_name }} ({{ user.phone_number }}), who has been assigned to handle your case. Failure to do so will result in this file being CLOSED.
